The closest apple to the snake is at (7, 1), which is directly to the right and down. However, moving right and down would put the snake in a position where it could potentially collide with the other snake or itself if it moves back up.

The next closest apple is at (7, 2), which is directly to the right. This move would also put the snake in a position where it could potentially collide with the other snake or itself if it moves back up.

The other apples are further away, so moving towards them would require more moves and could potentially put the snake in a position where it could collide with the other snake or itself.

Given these considerations, the safest move would be to move up, which would put the snake in a position where it can potentially collect the apple at (7, 1) without risking a collision with the other snake or itself.

**Strategy for next turn:**

Next turn, I will try to move towards the apple at (7, 1) without risking a collision with the other snake or myself.

**Next move:** UP
